definition: to spend (money or time)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses

sentences.english: You just hate waste, and when someone else costs you dearly you see red.
sentences.chinese: 你厭惡浪費，如果別人讓你大肆破費，你會發怒。

sentences.english: Find the approximate percent decrease in the cost per minute of a long-distance call?
sentences.chinese: 請得出長途電話每分鐘破費的大約增加的百分率？

sentences.english: But I think it would be a good birthday present…
sentences.chinese: 多謝先，咁破費呀，我十月生日，你儲定錢剛剛好。

sentences.english: You can buy meaningful gifts that don't have to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 買禮物不必破費太多，選有意義的即可。

sentences.english: Learning any language takes a lot of effort. but dont give up.
sentences.chinese: 學習任何言語都是需求破費很多努力，但不要保持。

sentences.english: Some of the most generous and romantic gifts cost nothing in terms of dollars and cents.
sentences.chinese: 有些最慷慨最浪漫的禮物並不需要破費分毫。

sentences.english: About sex, the pleasure is momentary, the position ridiculous and the expense damnable.
sentences.chinese: 快感只要那麼一瞬間，而付出的破費卻是驚人的。

definition: tip/gratuity/monetary reward/bonus
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
(to act) on one's own initiative
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to play deaf-mute
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
bird's nest
to smash
to force someone to do something
